de.fu.junction.converter
Class AnyConverter

java.lang.Object
  de.fu.junction.converter.AnyConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
StringConverter<Object>
public class AnyConverter
extends Object
implements StringConverter<Object>

Same as GenericConverter, but untyped (returns an Object) This class is needed as default Converter in the annotation.Param-Annotation. Since unfortunately one can not state things like GenericConverter<String>.class a Type is needed that does not feature any type-parameters.

The type to convert to needs to have a Converter having one parameter (and one parameter only) of the type string. Example types for which a generic conversion (since their constructor do it) can be done are Integer, BigDecimal or Double.

It’s worth noting that although the static type of the converted value is Object it’s dynamic type of course reflects the type which was specified when constructing the converter.

This special class also features a static method which is type-safe both statically and dynamically (@see convert(String, Class).
